ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2-3hrs- some weeks where one had to submit an assignment were more.
2-3 hours per week for the readings
8 hours per week
2h
1-2 for readings and 1 hour reviewing previous lectures for each quiz.
4 hours
Less than 1 hour

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: it was a requirement and I was unable to place out of it based on medical school courses. unfortunately, I felt it did not add to my MPH coursework or experience. it was busy work to fulfill a requirement.

the strengths of the course are located in the breadth of guest speakers that gave lectures throughout the semester. The weaknesses included: time of the day (8am) and the general pace of the course. Course materials were not available in ample time and placed on the course website. Quizzes were given to students even if they were 25 minutes late to class. The class, also, was heavily geared toward medical doctors, which made the 6 of us who were not doctors feel like we did not belong.

I enjoyed the course- it was educational. However, some of the instructors, while interesting and engaging were unfocussed, and unclear on who they were lecturing to. The two lectures on respiratory issues (asthma, cancer) were near impossible. One lecturer worked through a case about a person exposed to Radon, asbestos etc.etc. and while it engaged most in the class, the take home message was unclear. There were no notes. I have no objection to not having a powerpoint, but I do think there ought have been at least a brief overview of the talk to bring the readings together. On the flip side the other lecturer had a lecture that had too many slides- they seemed to be recycling a talk that was meant for physicians perhaps. The instructor on Food workers was very sweet but that was a talk that seemed to be directed to high school students. Some of the talks were great.
This class covers a lot of topics in environmental and occupational medicine. The broad range of topics was certainly interesting, though there wasn't really a flow between topics.
Excelllent course

I think the course was good for what it was. it didn't feel super relevant all the time but it was interesting and the instructors obviously cared about the information. I liked the speakers that cam and talked and i liked that the professors understood that this was a course that we were taking to get a specific skill set. they were very good about limiting the workload.
Strengths- Field visit and getting oriented to a specialty in medicine was a unique experience as a physician
Good course pattern and the field trip is very interesting

Good introduction to Occupational and Environmental Medicine. Breadth of topics was good and lectures were enjoyable. Favorite aspect was definitely the site visit; it was a great way to actually see and apply concepts learned in class to a real work environment. Quizzes and assignments were all appropriate in terms of content and difficulty. Both instructors were great and I liked all the guest lecturers who were invited to speak to the class. My one critique is that I would have liked to explore the Environmental Medicine component a bit more (I felt like the course was heavily geared towards Occupational Medicine).
Excellent introductory course for environmental and occupational health. A great strength are guest speakers for each lecture. Another plus are the field visits.
Great
It's a great course.

Very good overview of occupational and environmental medicine, profiling many of the separate fields and topics within the larger topic. Essential to understanding what this area of health care and safety is.
- guest lecturers were interesting - class time was too early - too many pop quizzes - site visits were good
Highly relevant course for me so this evaluation is biased - in my opinion this course was fantastic Despite the background in internal medicine I have learned a lot about this field,
strengths: Nice variation in lectures. Covered a wide breadth of topics in occ/env health. weaknesses: could have had more hands on experience/ site visits
Strengths: guest speakers each week were different and very good. It is not a difficult class, however you get out of it what you put into it.
Overall, I truly enjoyed this course. My only suggestion would be to do away with the random pop quizzes, especially since they were given at 8AM.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Carrie Redlich  both instructors were receptive to feedback and approachable. I felt like sometimes they interrupted each other and the speakers too much.

Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Very nice and knowledgeable, but never on time and always on her computer or doing other work. It's challenging for students to respect a classroom if it is painfully obvious a professor does not.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  She is very knowledgeable. Perhaps she ought do the respiratory lectures?
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Both Carrie and Meredith are passionate about the course, engaging with students, and immensely knowledgeable. It was a pleasure learning from them.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Excellent instructor
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Very experienced teacher
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Nice professors and ready to help
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Excellent instructor.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Great teaching
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  She's a great instructor.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Very knowledgable about the topic, and adds good insights into the class from personal experience and expertise.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Excellent
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Highly erudite and effective instructor, excellent lectures
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Very receptive to answering students questions. Very approachable and knowledgeable. She provided great examples during her lectures, which were very engaging.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Usually had guest speakers, although Carrie would bring up points during class. She also invited the entire class to her house for dinner which was so nice.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  both instructors were receptive to feedback and approachable. I felt like sometimes they interrupted each other and the speakers too much.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Very kind and understanding. She did give quizzes to those who were late, which was annoying to those of us who arrived on time each and every week.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Her presentation was also great.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Both Carrie and Meredith are passionate about the course, engaging with students, and immensely knowledgeable. It was a pleasure learning from them.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Excellent Instructor
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Very friendly and interactive. Vast knowledge base.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Nice professors and ready to help
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Excellent instructor.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Great teaching.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  She is an excellent teacher.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Very experienced with the field and brings that to the course. I learned a lot from her.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Excellent

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Meredith is a very nice and amazing person with a lot of experience in occ medicine. She listens to her students questions and always answer all of them. She really care about making sure you are learning new things in this class.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Meredith was wonderful, her passion for her subject shone through and she can answer any broad question you ask her.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Extremely effective instructor, knowledgeable and extremely approachable, excellent lectures
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Very prompt in answering questions/ providing feedback whether in class or via email. Very responsive and very approachable.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Supportive, helpful.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: easy way to fulfill enviro requirement for MPH.
OcMed concerns the risks and assessment of injuries (physical, chemical, and biological) that could take place within the work place.
Interesting, but some components very weak. Relatively easy course. Do the readings. Surprise quizzing.
Excellent course for students who want to learn more about occupational and environmental Medicine. I would highly recommend this course.
Good course. not too much workload. study for the quizzes but not really able to know what is going to be on it sometimes it felt arbitrary. will fulfill the credit without too much work.
Yes,makes you oriented to public and occupational health hazards.
It is a good course to learn about occupational and environmental exposures and problems.
See overall assessment.
Great introduction course for environmental and occupational health. Excellent guest speakers each experts in that weeks topic and field visits to apply the course materials. Schedule Tuesday 8-10.
Great
It's a good course.
Good introduction to the field of occupational and environmental medicine.
Great introductory course.
a good introductory class
I would recommend this course for students wanting/needing a general overview of occupational and environmental medicine.

It is an easy class that requires very little outside time. You will learn about many different aspects of work related health exposures. There are pop quizzes (5 or 6 during the semester) so need to go to class Midterm and final were take-home write-ups
